{{Infobox person | name = Ghanim bin Saad | image = | birth_date = {{birth date |1964|8|23|df=y}} | native_name = غانم بن سعد ال سعد | birth_place = [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] | residence = [[Doha]] | nationality = [[Qatari]] | occupation = [[Chairman]] of [[GSSG Holding]]
| Main Industry = [[Real Estate]] }}
'''Ghanim Bin Saad Al Saad''' ({{lang-ar|غانم بن سعد ال سعد}} born 23 August 1964 in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]]) is a [[Qatari]] business leader and the Chairman of [[GSSG Holding]], a family business diversified into dozens of sectors and companies. He assumed a prominent role with other international leaders at the ‘Arab World Renewal’ forum in Paris in January 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thinkers-doers.com/ |title=Thinkers & Doers: Leaders Who Make Things Happen |publisher=Thinkers & Doers |date=January 1, 2015}}</ref> He won the TAKREEM Award for Outstanding Corporate Leader in 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Buly5WISK58 |title=Ghanim Bin Saad Al Saad - The TAKREEM Award for Outstanding Corporate Leader |publisher=Takreem Initiative |date=November 28, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/arabian-business-qatar-power-list-2012-443489.html?view=profile&itemid=443442#.VSfMTfmUecs |title=Arabian Business Qatar Power List 2012 |publisher=Arabian Business |date=January 1, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.takreem.net/IndividualDetails.aspx?Individual=2752&pageid=2744 |title=Ghanim Bin Saad Al Saad - Qatar |publisher=Takreem}}</ref> Al Saad ranks number 12 on the CEO Middle East Property Power List.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/ceo-property-power-list-269587.html?view=profile&itemid=269598#.VSfbiPmUect |title=CEO Middle East Property Power List |publisher=Arabian Business |date=April 22, 2010}}</ref> He was featured at number 27 on the Arabian Business Qatar Power List of 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/arabian-business-qatar-power-list-2012-443489.html?view=profile&itemid=443442#.VSfMTfmUecs |title=Arabian Business Qatar Power List 2012 |publisher=Arabian Business |date=January 1, 2012}}</ref> Al Saad has also received the title of ‘Datuk’, the Malaysian equivalent of a British peerage from the King of Malaysia.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kln.gov.my/web/qat_doha/home/-/asset_publisher/8pPT/blog/his-majesty-the-king-of-malaysia-honours-two-distinguished-qatari-citizens?redirect=%2Fweb%2Fqat_doha%2F |title=His Majesty the King of Malaysia Honours Two Distinguished Qatari Citizens |publisher=Official Website of the Embassy of Malaysia, Doha |access-date=May 4, 2015}}</ref> He also holds the position of chairman in several businesses including Al Imtiaz Investment Company, A'ayan Real Estate, Al Jazeera Academy, Rizon Partners, Jersey Group, Ghanim Bin Saad Al Saad & Sons Holdings Group, QatarAG and Rizon Jet. He is also the CEO and General Manager of First Finance Company, consultant and board member of Barwa Bank.
==Education== Al Saad received a BA in Social Sciences from Qatar University. He holds a master's degree in Social Policy & Administration from Kent University in the UK and a PhD from Greenwich University, London.<ref name=":0">{{cite web |url=http://www.takreem.net/IndividualDetails.aspx?Individual=2752&pageid=2744 |title=Ghanim Bin Saad Al Saad - Qatar |publisher=Takreem}}</ref>
== Career ==
Al Saad’s early career included the position of Director at the Ministry of Cabinet Affairs in 1998, after working at the Ministry of Justice and the Supreme Council for Planning in Qatar. He has held the position of Ambassador for Qatar’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1998 to the present day.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.qatarinvcorp.com/about-us/board-of-director/ |title=About Ghanim Bin Saad Al Saad |publisher=Qatar Investment Corporation |access-date=May 4, 2015}}</ref> He has also worked as an adviser to the Prime Minister of Qatar, [[Hamad bin Jassim bin Jaber Al Thani|Sheikh Hamad Bin Jassim Al-Thani]], on business investments for Qatar’s Sovereign Fund, recommending a number of international acquisitions.<ref name=":0" />
He founded The Jersey Group in 1994, which is now known as the Ghanim Bin Saad Al Saad & Sons Holdings (GSSG) Group and which was incorporated it in 2007. GSSG includes over 30 companies around the world and spans real estate, manufacturing, contracting, engineering, information technology and telecommunications, aviation, automobiles, oil & gas, education, fitness, hospitality and fashion. The company’s corporate headquarters are in Qatar, with regional headquarters in London, Cairo and Singapore.
GSSG’s subsidiaries include Rizon Jet, the first private jet operator in the Middle East.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arabaviation.com/en-us/countrybriefs/qatar/rizonjet.aspx |title=Country Briefs, Qatar |publisher=Arab Aviation |access-date=May 4, 2015}}</ref>
==Board memberships and charity==
Al Saad joined the General Assembly of Qatar Charity in 2001. He became a Board Member in 2001. He was appointed as Chairman of the charity on 13 October 2010 and he remains the current Chairman.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.unrwa.org/newsroom/press-releases/government-qatar-through-qatar-charity-contribute-us-10-million-unrwa |title=The Government of Qatar Through The Qatar Charity Contribute US $10 Million to UNRWA |publisher=United Nations |date=April 28, 2009}}</ref>
He held the position of Chairman and Managing Director of Barwa Real Estate Company (January 2006 – April 2011). Barwa Real estate is a semi-governmental real estate company 45% owned by Qatari Diar and 55% listed on the Doha Stock Exchange.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=159199229&ticker=TTA:TB&previousCapId=879846&previousTitle=IRPC%2520PCL |title=Industrials Sector, Marine Industry |publisher=Bloomberg Business |date=April 30, 2015}}</ref>
Al Saad was a Board Member, CEO and Managing Director of Qatari Diar Real Estate Company from 2008 to 2011. Qatari Diar is the wholly owned real estate arm of the Qatar Investment Authority and the Government of Qatar.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.euromoney.com/Article/1969071/Qatari-Diar-lays-foundations-for-global-growth.html |title=Qatari Diar Lays Foundations for Global Growth |publisher=EuroMoney |date=June 6, 2008}}</ref> He is currently the company's chief executive officer.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/companies/qatari-diar-real-estate-investment-company-69328.html|title=Qatari Diar Real Estate Investment Company|publisher=arabianbusiness.com|accessdate=22 July 2015}}</ref> He was Chairman of Barwa Bank from 2009 – 2010.
He held the position of Chairman of the Qatar Railways Company 2010 – 2011. Qatar Railways was set up under Al Saad’s chairmanship to drive the policy of having an integrated rail network inside Qatar and linking to the regional network of GCC (Gulf Co-operation Council) countries.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.qatarisbooming.com/article/qatari-diar-appoints-board-directors-qatar-railways-company |title=Qatari Diar Appoints Board of Directors for Qatar Railways Company |publisher=EuroMoney |date=March 6, 2011}}</ref>
Al Saad was a Member of the Qatar-Bahrain Causeway Committee.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/11/22/qatar-transport-railways-idUSGEE5AL03Z20091122 |title=Qatar eyes 2022 for key links in $23 bln rail deal |publisher=Reuters |date=November 22, 2009}}</ref> He has also been Chairman and Board Member of various subsidiaries and affiliates of Qatari Diar and Barwa Real Estate. Al Saad is a Board Member of the Qatar Investment Corporation.
=="Renewal of the Arab World" Summit in Paris, January 2015==
Al Saad was a featured speaker at the ‘Renewal of the Arab World’ conference at the Arab Institute in Paris, January 2015, along with President Francois Hollande of France, Foreign Minister of France Laurent Fabius and Jack Lang, President of the Arab Institute and many other international leaders dedicated to building stronger ties between all faiths.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thinkers-doers.com/wp-content/uploads/20150114-Programme-IMA-EN.pdf |title=International Program: Institute du Monde Arabe |publisher=Thinkers & Doers |date=January 14, 2015}}</ref>
== Awards and recognition== *TAKREEM Award for Outstanding Corporate Leader (2011)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.takreemawards.com/candidates/index.php?sect=2&i=21&year=2011 |title=TAKREEM official website |publisher=Takreemawards.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-20}}</ref> *65th Rank in the ''[[Arabian Business|Arabian Business'<nowiki/>]]'' list "The world’s 100 most influential Arabs 2009"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/power-100-2009/list |title=Power 100 - Special Reports |publisher=[[Arabian Business]] |date= |accessdate=2013-10-20}}</ref> *50th on Arabian Business' "Qatar Power List 2015" <ref>{{Cite web|title = Qatar Power List 2015|url = http://www.arabianbusiness.com/qatar-power-list-2015-612180.html?view=profile&itemid=612179#.Vm_WpsmDFBc|website = Arabian Business|accessdate = 2015-12-15}}</ref>

'''Ǵorǵija 'George' Atanasoski''' or '''Gjorgjija Atanasoski''' ({{lang-mk|Ѓорѓија 'Џорџ' Атанасоски}}) (born February 18, 1952 in [[Marul]], [[Prilep Municipality]], [[SFR Yugoslavia]], today [[Republic of Macedonia]]) is a [[Macedonians (ethnic group)|Macedonian]] businessman and politician. He is the founder of MAK AM International Corporation and [[Microflex Inc.]], and president of Makedonska Alijansa, a Macedonian political party.
==Career== Gjorgjija Atanasoski left [[SFR Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]] in 1970 for [[New York City]], United States. Atanasoski started his career as an engineer working for [[New York University]]. After being five years in the United States, Atanasoski in 1975 founded [[Microflex Inc.]] with his brother Josif, an international corporation manufacturing flexible metal products based in [[Ormond Beach]], [[Florida]] and supplying a wide range of industries, with customers including [[NASA]].
In 1996, Atanasoski co-founded and became president of MAK AM International Corporation, an international trading company mostly concerned with importing and exporting to and from [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonia]].
==Key achievements and awards==
* Founder of [[Microflex Inc.]], (1975) * member and later secretary of the Macedonian Society of New York (1974–1980) * elected for President of the World Macedonian Congress of [[North America]], (1992) * Founder of the first Macedonian international weekly magazine [[Makedonsko Sonce]] (''Macedonian Sun''), (1994) * former candidate for the [[President of the Republic of Macedonia]], (1994) * Founder and president of [[MAK AM International Corporation]], (1996) * Founder and president of the political party Makedonska Alijansa (''Macedonian Alliance''), (1996) * [[Ellis Island Medal of Honor]], (2004) * [[United Macedonian Diaspora]] Lifetime Achievement Award, (2011) <ref>http://www.umdiaspora.org/index.php/en/unity-issues-contents/271-3rd-annual-umd-global-conference-in-washington-dc-huge-success</ref><ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I1MPSJTIt80</ref>
==Political and activist career== In 1974, Atansoski became secretary of the Macedonian Society of New York, a Macedonian ex-patriate organization promoting Macedonian culture, history and causes in the USA. He has sponsored many Macedonian cultural events and societies, and lobbies for Macedonian human rights to the [[US Government]] and many other bodies. In May 1992 he founded the [[World Macedonian Congress]], consider itself as an organization fighting and demanding for more human rights to ethnic Macedonians on an international level, but is seen as an [[Ultranationalism|ultranationalist]] organization by independent researchers and media. Atanasoski is the president of the North American chapter of the MWC, one of the most influential chapters. His work with the MWC ranges from sponsoring historical studies of Macedonia to co-ordinating humanitarian relief efforts.
On June 24, 1994, Atanasoski founded [[Makedonsko Sonce]], a weekly Macedonian international newspaper, the first non-government-controlled newspaper in Macedonian, open to contributions from all citizens.
In 1994 Atanasoski stood as a candidate for [[President of Macedonia]], on a ticket of democratic and free market principles, and the de-corruption and legalisation of the state, as well as the enhancement of the economic and social development of Macedonia. Since 1996, Atanasoski has been the president of the Makedonska Alijansa (Macedonian Alliance) political party.
On May 14, 2005, Atanasoski has been rewarded with the [[Ellis Island Medal of Honor]].{{citation needed|date=March 2016}}

'''Global Management Challenge''' ('''GMC''') is a strategic management competition for managers and university students. Participants form teams of 3-5 members, and each team is placed in a group of 5-8 teams, depending the competition. The teams are then given a virtual company, initially identical to every other company in the competition. Each team then develops their company by making a series of decisions relating to every aspect of the business, such as how many machines to buy, or how much to spend on advertising. In each round, five sets of decisions are taken, corresponding to five quarters. A quarter is a period said to span three months. These decisions - made on the Decision Sheet - are run through sophisticated business simulation software, which generates in-depth Management Reports, showing the consequences of the decisions. The aim is to finish the game with the highest share-price on the virtual stock exchange. The competition is divided into rounds with usually 3 or 4 rounds on national level and 2 rounds on international level. The number of national rounds can vary in each country and depends on number of participants. Some countries use slightly different approach and combine Global Management Challenge with other competitions. In India teams compete in another competition which is more sector related (e.g. they run a car manufacturing company) and the last 8 teams join GMC national final. Also in Germany the participants play GMC only in their final round. As it might seem interesting it brings disadvantage to those teams because they are not so familiar with the simulation compared to other teams on the international level. == History == The concept of the competition emerged in 1980 in Portugal by SDG – Simuladores e Modelos de Gestão – in partnership with [[Expresso (Portuguese newspaper)|Expresso]], a weekly newspaper. The GMC computer model was designed by [http://www.edit515.co.uk Edit 515 Limited], registered in [[Scotland]], U.K. It is updated frequently to reflect real world trading conditions and business risks, the aim being to present competitors with very realistic and complex business scenarios, with varied challenges and problems. The Global Management Challenge is now the world's biggest strategic management competition - 20000 participants annually. More than 400,000 university students and company managers around the world participated since 1980. Thirty-three countries currently participate in the contest: [[Angola]], [[Australia]], [[Belarus]], [[Belgium]], [[Bolivia]], [[Brazil]], [[Czech Republic]], [[Denmark]], [[Finland]], [[France]], [[Germany]], [[Ghana]], [[Greece]], [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong SAR (China)]], [[Hungary]], [[India]], [[Italy]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Latvia]], [[Macau|Macau SAR (China)]], [[Mexico]], [[Morocco]], [[People's Republic of China]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]], [[Romania]], [[Russia]], [[Singapore]], [[Slovakia]], [[Spain]], [[Turkey]], [[Ukraine]], [[United Kingdom]] and [[Venezuela]]. For the 2010-2011 session, two new African countries are entering the contest: [[Ivory Coast]], [[Benin]], in partnership with Educarriere.net, a leading website in Ivory Coast which have been famous because it used to publish the result of many exams. Each country organizes its own National competition, the model producing all material in the language of that country. The winners of the National competition meet to contest the International Semi-Finals and, if successful, go on to compete in the International Final (with results still in each of the countries' native language). == World Champions == In 1980—the first year of the competition—only Portuguese teams competed. For the next two years, the GMC winner was decided by a Luso-Brazilian final, between Portugal and Brazil. Brazil won in 1981 and Portugal won in 1982. Since 1983, the winner has been decided at an International Final, hosted by one of the competing countries. [[File:Granvia L'H, vist des del cementiri de Montjuic.JPG|thumb|right|]] {{Other uses|Gran Via (disambiguation){{!}}Gran Via}} '''Gran Via''' ({{IPA-ca|ˈɡɾam ˈbi.ə}}) is the second major [[business district]] of [[Barcelona]], after [[Diagonal Mar]]. Part of [[Fira de Barcelona]], second largest trade fair and exhibition centres in [[Europe]]. Lies on borderline of [[Barcelona]], [[L'Hospitalet de Llobregat]] and [[El Prat de Llobregat]]. Gran Via business center consists some parts: ''Gran Via'' with 240,000 m² of exhibition floor space divided into 8 pavilions,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firabcn.es/location/granVia.do |title=Fira de Barcelona, Venues - Gran Via}}</ref> ''Gran Via Convention Centre'', with a capacity of 5,600 delegates and 14,000 m² surface area,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firabcn.es/location/conventionCenter.do |title=Fira de Barcelona, Venues - Convention Centre Gran Via}}</ref> skyscrapers alongside [[Plaza de Europa]], with over ten skyscrapers and ''Gran Vía 2'' near [[Barcelona International Airport]], shop center propertied 200 shops, 20 restaurants, 15 cinemas and hypermarket.<ref>[http://www.granvia2.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=74&Itemid=149 About Gran Vía 2] - granvia2.com</ref> Also, it adjacent to [[Ciutat de la Justícia de Barcelona i l'Hospitalet de Llobregat]], hosts most of the legal departments of the [[Barcelona metropolitan area]].
== Public transport == The "Gran Via" center is served by line 8 of the [[Barcelona Metro]] and [[Ferrocarrils de la Generalitat de Catalunya|FGC]] commuter train network, at the [[Europa-Fira (Barcelona Metro)|Europa-Fira station]], and also by the bus line 79.

No || Name<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.emporis.com/sp/wm/zo/?id=100307 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-09-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110604210308/http://www.emporis.com/sp/wm/zo/?id=100307 |archivedate=2011-06-04 |df= }}</ref> || Height || Floors || Year || Used |- | 1 || [[Hotel Porta Fira]] || 113 m ||align=center| 28 ||align=center| 2010 ||align=center| Hotel |- | 2 || [[Torre Realia BCN]] || 112 m ||align=center| 24 ||align=center| 2010 ||align=center| Offices |- | 3 || [[Renaissance Barcelona Fira Hotel]] || 105 m ||align=center| 25 ||align=center| 2011 ||align=center| Hotel |- | 4 || [[Torre Inbisa]] || 104 m ||align=center| 26 ||align=center| 2010 ||align=center| Offices |- | 5 || [[Torre Zenit]] || 104 m ||align=center| 26 ||align=center| 2008 ||align=center| Offices |- | 6 || [[Torres Europa|Torre Europa III]] || 75 m ||align=center| 19 ||align=center| 2009 ||align=center| Residencial |- | 7 || [[Torres Europa|Torre Europa IV]] || 75 m ||align=center| 19 ||align=center| 2009 ||align=center| Residencial |- | 8 || [[Torres Europa|Torre Europa V]] || 75 m ||align=center| 19 ||align=center| 2009 ||align=center| Residencial |}

'''Günter Herlitz''' (February 9, 1913 – September 11, 2010<ref>Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, September 14th, 2010</ref>) was born in [[Berlin]] as the son of [[:de:Carl Herlitz|Carl Herlitz]], founder of the [[Herlitz|Herlitz stationery company]].
==Biography== Following the founding of the company by his father in 1904, Günter Herlitz took over the business in 1935. He expanded the company from Berlin into [[Province of Brandenburg|Mark Brandenburg]] and already counted six employees to help with the business. When he was conscripted for military service during the Second World War, Günter Herlitz’s mother took on the running of the business.
During the Second World War, the business premises were destroyed by bombs several times, and thus Günter Herlitz resumed business operations in 1945, following completion of his military service, in a basement in the Berlin district of [[Moabit]]. Initially selling bargains of all kinds, the Herlitz company was the only one of around 20 Berlin wholesalers to succeed in securing a minimal amount of goods during the [[Berlin Blockade]]. When the blockade ended, the company extended its product range considerably. As one of the most important wholesale firms nationwide, Herlitz was able to employ 50 people by 1950.
Due to the political situation in Germany at the time, it became increasingly difficult for the company to get its goods from West Germany to Berlin. As a result, Günter Herlitz decided to manufacture his own stationery. The company began with the production of exercise books, drawing pads and index cards. In 1955, the company was already processing 60 tons of paper each month. Even though the political situation at the time initially prevented Herlitz from supplying customers outside [[West Berlin]], the company was able to boast an annual turnover circa 1.1 million Euro.
Initial attempts to sell the products on the West German market were unsuccessful; however, in 1960, the breakthrough came about with notebooks and drawing pads with illustrated covers, which was an absolute novelty at the time.<ref>Der Tagessiegel, October 27th, 1960</ref> In the following years, from 1960 to 1994, the company was able to double its turnover each year. This meant an increase in annual turnover from 2 million Euros in 1960 to 885 million Euros in 1994.
In 1996, Günter Herlitz was honoured for his life’s work at the company’s general meeting and resigned from the board of management. He became the company’s honorary chairman. From then on, he never attended another general meeting of the company.
To this day, the company headquarters are located in Berlin.
After the death of Günter Herlitz in September 2010, his family continues his social commitment and is amongst the most active families in Berlin. In 2003 his son, [[Klaus and Eva Herlitz|Dr Klaus Herlitz]] and his wife founded the [[Buddy Bear Help]] children's charities organization.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.herlitz.de/en.html Official Website of Herlitz AG]

{{coord|40|44|48|N|73|59|12|W|display=title}} [[File:Hotel Wolcott from west.jpg|thumb|right|250px|The Hotel Wolcott as seen from the west]]
The '''Hotel Wolcott''' at 4 [[31st Street (Manhattan)|West 31st Street]] between [[Fifth Avenue|Fifth]] and [[Avenue of the Americas|Sixth]] Avenues in the [[Midtown Manhattan|Midtown East]] neighborhood of [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]], was built between 1902 and 1904 by developer William C. Dewey and was designed by the prominent architect [[John H. Duncan]], who employed a bold French [[Beaux-Arts architecture|Beaux-Arts]] style combined with French [[Neoclassical architecture|Neo Classicism]].<ref>''Architects' and Builders' Magazine''(September 1903)</ref> The hotel was named after Henry Roger Wolcott, a businessman, politician and philanthropist.<ref name=desrep>[[New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission]] [http://www.nyc.gov/html/lpc/downloads/pdf/reports/2423.pdf "Hotel Wolcott Designation Report"], (December 20, 2011)</ref>
[[File:Hotel Wolcott entrance.jpg|thumb|left|250px|The entrance to the Hotel Wolcott]]
Before it was even completed, the building was leased by Dewey to James H. Breslin, a prominent hotelier of the time, for three years. Nonetheless, Dewey had difficulty with the financing for the building: unable to purchase steel locally, he imported it from Europe, which caused an unusually long construction period, which in turn made it difficult for Dewey to pay his creditors. In early 1905 The American Mortgage Company repossessed the building, which was sold at auction. Breslin's lease remained, but the hotel passed through the hands of a series of owners in the following decades.<ref name=desrep />
The hotel was popular with travelers, but also housed many permanent residents, including dancer [[Isadora Duncan]] and [[Doris Duke]], the heiress. Other prominent guests of the hotel included [[Edith Wharton]] and [[Henry Miller]], and [[Buddy Holly]] and the [[Everly Brothers]] stayed there while recording at Beltone Studios, which was in the building. The hotel also hosted events such as the meeting where [[Jacob Ruppert|Col. Jake Ruppert]] and [[Tillinghast Huston|Col. Tillinghast Huston]] purchased the [[New York Yankees]] in 1914 and [[Fiorello La Guardia]]'s inauguration ball in 1938.<ref name=desrep />
On December 20, 2011 the hotel was designated a [[List of New York City Landmarks|New York City landmark]] by the [[New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission]].<ref name=desrep />

'''Jan Hugo Isidoor Coene''' (born in 1957), is a Belgian businessman who fell in disgrace because of the Picanol Scandal.
As a young trainee, he joined [[Brown, Boveri & Cie]] (BBC) Workshops in Brussels. In 1988, BBC merged with [[ASEA]], to become [[ABB Asea Brown Boveri]]. In 2001 he left ABB and became the CEO & Chairman of [[Picanol]], a world-wide leader in textile machinery and related services.
In 2003, he became Chairman of [[Belgacom]], the Belgian national telephone company which he led to an [[Initial Public Offering|IPO]], working closely with its owner, the Belgian Government.
In 2004, the press revealed the level of his incomes from [[Picanol]].<ref name="rtbf">Source: [http://old.rtbf.be/rtbf_2000/bin/view_something.cgi?type=article&id=0168529_article&menu=default&pub=RTBF.PORTAIL%2FPORTAIL.FR.la_taille.SP.SOCI RTBF.be's article (in french)]</ref> These incomes were judged greatly excessive by the press, considering the usual Belgian remunerations for the functions of upper management. The lack of transparency was also pointed out, in particular by company's minority shareholders.<ref>Source: [http://www.deminor.com/articles.do?id=3591 Deminor's article (in french)]</ref> Facing growing criticism, Jan Coene was forced to resign from both [[Picanol]] and [[Belgacom]] in October 2004.<ref name="essent">Source: [http://cours.funoc.be/essentiel/article/article.php?idart=215&id_result=Pierre-Henry%20Thomas L'Essentiel's article]</ref> He accepted to reimburse ten million euros to [[Picanol]] (which because of the height of the sums reserved for Jan Coene had become financially unhealthy) but kept 12 million.<ref>Source: [http://www.hrmblogs.net/blogs.asp?iid=A64] HumanResourcesBlog (HMR Blog - in dutch)</ref>
The affair became a political issue in Belgium and a bill was introduced in Parliament (the "Picanol law") to force big companies to publish the remuneration of their upper management personnel.
In the meanwhile, the affair also shed another bad light on the Network of Vlerick-Boys, a circle of business men with low moral standards who all studied at the Vlerick Management School.<ref>Source: [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=GN19NUFI Series of Articles Het Nieuwsblad (in dutch)]</ref> Members of the circle include Jan Coene, Ronald Everaert, Luc Debruyckere and Louis Verbeke, who were all implied in scandals of greed, mismanagement and fraude (Lernout & Hauspie, Ter Beke, Picanol).<ref>Source: [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=GN19NUG3 Article Series Het Nieuwsblad (in dutch)]</ref> The circle entertains business connections and helps its members to get in the direction committees of Belgian industry. As one of the only remaining "clean managers" Jan Coene was named president of the alumni of the Vlerick Management School. But he also had to quit presidency after the 2004 Picanol scandal.
Other of Jan Coene's professional activities include: Director and Board Member of various companies: Domo, Committee Koning Boudenwijnsticthing, Flanders, Federation of Flemish Enterprises, co-founder of BBE (Belgian Business for Europe), member of the World Economic Forum (since 2002), Chairman of Siveco Group SA, a company providing [[CMMS]] products worldwide.
Jan Coene is married with 2 children.

{{Infobox Officeholder | name =János Kóka | image =Dr. János Kóka.jpg | caption =Dr. János Kóka as Chairman and CEO of Cellum Global Zrt. (2013) | order =[[Politics of Hungary|Minister of Economy and Transport]] | term_start =4 October 2004 | term_end =3 December 2007 | president = | predecessor =[[István Csillag]] | successor =[[Csaba Kákosy]] | birth_date ={{Birth date and age|df=yes|1972|07|05}} | birth_place =[[Budapest]], [[People's Republic of Hungary|Hungary]] | death_date= | death_place= | spouse = Edit Varga | children =Bianka
Lilla
Dániel | profession =manager, entrepreneur, former politician | party =[[SZDSZ]] (2006–2010) |}} {{eastern name order|Kóka János}} '''János Kóka''' (born 5 July 1972) is a [[Hungary|Hungarian]] businessman, private investor, IT entrepreneur and manager of various enterprises, who served as Minister of Economy and Transport between 2004 and 2007. He was a member of the [[Alliance of Free Democrats]] (SZDSZ) and functioned as its chairman from 2007 to 2008. He also served as leader of the liberal party's parliamentary group until [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2010|2010]], when SZDSZ failed to win any seats after 20 years. Kóka left the party that year. In 2010 he returned to business life and presently works as Chairman and CEO of Cellum Global Zrt. and Chairman of the Board of Cellum Bulgaria. He is married to Edit Varga.{{cite web|url=http://www.origo.hu/teve/20160503-varga-edit-interju-2016-virtuozok-jatek-hatarok-nelkul-hirado-mtv-duna-tv.html|title=Varga Edit: Otthon és a képernyőn is van értelmes feladatom|work=[[Origo (website)|Origo]]|accessdate=3 May 2018}} ==Education== He graduated from Temesvári Pelbárt Franciscan Grammar School in [[Esztergom]]. He continued his studies at [[Semmelweis University]] of Medicine, where he received his degree in 1996.{{Citation needed|date=January 2016}} ==Business career== Kóka got involved in the emerging Hungarian IT industry while still at university, working as Project Manager and later Sales Director at one of Hungary's first [[Internet Service Provider|ISPs]], Elender LLC from 1994 and 1996. From 1996 he served as Managing Director of Elender Computer LLC, then from 1998, following the company's transformation into a private limited company, as CEO of Elender IT, Inc. In 1999 Elender was acquired by [[PSINet|PSINet, Inc.]] and Kóka became Country Manager, then from 2000 European Vice President of Business Development. He also became Chairman of the Board of Webigen Inc. in July 2000. He returned to his former company in October 2002, serving as CEO of Elender Business Communications. In 2004 he was appointed President of Euroweb Internet Service Provider Inc.{{Citation needed|date=January 2016}} He was a board member of the ICT Association of Hungary (IVSZ) from 2000, and President from March 2003 until October 2004. From 2003 prior to his ministerial appointment he served as Member of the Board of EICTA (European ICT Association) based in Brussels, and Chairman of the Hungarian-Indonesian Joint Business Council. In 2000 he received the ’IT Manager of the Year’ award founded by the ICT Association of Hungary. ==Political career== In October 2004, Kóka was appointed Minister of Economy and Transport, supported by [[Alliance of Free Democrats|SZDSZ]], which he later became a member of in 2006. During this period his main tasks included the development of a business-friendly environment, stimulating the growth of the corporate sector, promoting a knowledge-based economy and increasing the international presence of domestic businesses. In June 2006 he was reappointed Minister of Economy and Transport. Between 2007-2008 he served as President of the Liberal Party, and until 2010 as parliamentary group leader, member of the Budget Committee, and Chairman of the Nabucco Committee aiming to reduce the country's reliance on Russian gas. His popularity began to drop in 2006[http://www.szondaipsos.hu/hu/polvelkut/politikusok Politikusok népszerűsége] – A Szonda Ipsos honlapján following the announcement of his Ministry's intention to shut down 14 regional lines of [[Hungarian State Railways]] on a total length of {{convert|474|km|abbr=on}}. The government, referring to obligation under the constitution, ensured access to public transit in all settlements by installing bus routes and buses from Volán, which, in cases of single railway stations for multiple villages, meant stations in the centers or ends of every settlement. It was expected that this and an increased service frequency could theoretically be achieved while reducing spending on fuel (diesel or electricity) and maintenance.{{cite web | url = http://index.hu/gazdasag/magyar/szemsz060705/ | title = Hív a vasút, zár a MÁV | work = Index | date = 2006-07-05 | accessdate = 2007-03-26}} He considers the most important achievements of his ministerial activities to be the construction of 500 km of motorway, the influx of EUR 4-5 billion of operating capital annually into the country and the commencement of the construction of Megyeri Bridge. On March 31, 2008, various reform-related disagreements between the [[Hungarian Socialist Party]] (MSZP) and SZDSZ led SZDSZ leader Kóka to announce that his party would quit the coalition by May 1, 2008.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20080331/wl_nm/hungary_politics_dc |title=Archived copy |accessdate=April 10, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080414164602/http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20080331/wl_nm/hungary_politics_dc |archivedate=April 14, 2008 }} This also meant that MSZP would have to form the first [[minority government]] in [[Hungary]] since the political transition in 1990. However, the legitimacy of Kóka's position as party president became questioned when it was discovered that some signatures of the delegates to the assembly electing him had been forged. Since he had won his position by a very small margin over [[Gábor Fodor (politician)|Gábor Fodor]], these votes might have changed the outcome. Consequently, a new leadership election was held in June [http://nol.hu/cikk/488203/] and Gábor Fodor was returned.[http://index.hu/politika/belfold/szdszpp08070/ Fodor nyerte az elnökválasztást] Index, 2008. június 7. In 2009, the parliamentary group he led ensured the majority of votes to elect [[Gordon Bajnai]] Prime Minister and facilitate the measures taken by the Bajnai Government. He did not run during the parliamentary elections in 2010 and he did not renew his party membership either. ==Post-political career== After leaving politics in 2010[http://hvg.hu/itthon.partonbelul/20100627_szdsz_szabadai_ujratervezes Az ősbölények leléptek – SZDSZ küldöttgyűlés], hvg.hu, 2010. június 27. Kóka returned to the business world. First he was involved in the reorganization of Cellum Group as a consultant, then in 2011 he was appointed Chairman and CEO of Cellum Global Inc., established with the aim of international expansion.[http://nol.hu/lap/gazdasag/20110910-koka_janos_visszatert Kóka János visszatér] – Népszabadság 2011. szeptember 10.[http://hirszerzo.hu/profit/20110915_bulgaria_koka_cellum] – MTI 2011. szeptember 15.[http://www.origo.hu/techbazis/hightech/20111025-mastercard-mobilba-koltozik-a-bankkartya.html Az sms mellett pénzt is küldhetünk a mobillal] – Origo, 2011. 10. 25. As the representative of the company, in September 2011, he concluded a venture capital program agreement with Portfolion Zrt., member of [[OTP Bank]] Group, and soon afterwards he signed an agreement with Bulgaria's Corpbank on the establishment of a joint technological subsidiary.[http://www.telecompaper.com/news/bulgarias-corporate-commercial-bank-to-offer-m-payments Bulgaria's Corporate Commercial Bank to offer m-payments], Telecom Paper, Friday 16 September 2011. Since January 2012 he has served as Chairman of the Board of Directors in the Cellum Bulgaria subsidiary, with its head office in [[Bulgaria]]. He is a board member in MPP Zrt., also a Cellum Group affiliate. Under his management, the company has reported the conclusion of several international agreements of cooperation; for instance, Cellum developed the mobile payment application of [[MasterCard]].[http://www.thepaypers.com/news/mobile-payments/mastercard-cellum-to-provide-mobile-payments-in-hungary/745654-16 MasterCard, Cellum to provide mobile payments in Hungary], The Paypers, Tuesday 25 October 2011. ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.parlament.hu/internet/plsql/ogy_kpv.kepv_adat?p_azon=k057&p_ckl=38 Kóka János országgyűlési adatlapja] *[http://www.managermagazin.hu/magazin.php?page=article&id=536 A managermagazin.hu portréja] *[http://index.hu/politika/belfold/koka5362/ Pumázó playboy a bársonyszékben] – az Index cikke Kóka János miniszteri pályafutásáról *[http://www.hirtv.hu/musorok/?article_hid=84905 Az SZDSZ elnökválasztásáról szóló információk] *[http://www.kokajanos.hu Kóka János honlapja] *[http://fn.hir24.hu/nagyinterju/2011/11/06/koka-janos-sose-voltam-a-playboy-cimlapjan/ Sose voltam a Playboy címlapján - interjú az FN24-ben] *[http://www.bnettv.com/cellum-dr-janos-koka/ televíziós interjú a jelenlegi üzletei tevékenységről] *[https://www.linkedin.com/in/kokaj/ Kóka János on LinkedIn] {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box|title=[[Politics of Hungary|Minister of Economy and Transport]]|before=[[István Csillag]]|after=[[Csaba Kákosy]]|years=2004–2007}} {{succession box|title=[[Politics of Hungary|Minister of Health]]
Acting|before=[[Lajos Molnár]]|after=[[Ágnes Horváth]]|years=2007}} {{s-par|hu}} {{s-bef|before=[[Mátyás Eörsi]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Leader of the [[Alliance of Free Democrats|SZDSZ]] parliamentary group|years=2007–2010}} {{s-aft|after=Last}} {{s-ppo}} {{Succession box | before = [[Gábor Kuncze]] | title = [[Alliance of Free Democrats|President of the Alliance of Free Democrats]] | years = 2007–2008 | after = [[Gábor Fodor (politician)|Gábor Fodor]] }} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Koka, Janos}} [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hungarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Government ministers of Hungary]] [[Category:Alliance of Free Democrats politicians]] [[Category:Members of the National Assembly of Hungary (2006–10)]] [[Category:People from Budapest]]

{{Infobox musical artist |image_size = |name = Kerry Ashby Gordy |image = |caption = |background = non_performing_personnel |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1959|06|25}} |birth_place = [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]], U.S. |origin = Detroit, Michigan |instrument = {{hlist|Piano|[[keyboard instrument|keyboard]]}} |genre = {{hlist|[[R&B]]|[[Soul music|soul]]|[[Pop music|pop]]}} |occupation = [[Record executive]], Intellectual property manager, personal manager, [[songwriter]], [[record producer]] |years_active = 1973-present |label = {{hlist|Nu Vintage, LLC|Kerry Gordy Enterprises, LLC}} }}
'''Kerry Ashby Gordy''' (born June 25, 1959) is a music industry executive and a member of the Gordy family of [[Motown]] fame. He is the son of [[Motown]] records founder [[Berry Gordy]], the half-brother of singer and rapper [[Redfoo]] and [[Rhonda Ross Kendrick|Rhonda Ross]], daughter of Motown legend [[Diana Ross]].
==Early years== Gordy was born in [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]] the same year that his father, [[Berry Gordy|Berry Gordy, Jr.]], founded [[Motown]] Records. Gordy was brought home from the hospital to live in the historic home that housed the Hitsville Motown Recording Studios on West Grand Blvd. which was renamed Berry Gordy Jr. Blvd. Gordy’s mother, Raynoma, was a child prodigy in music and played eleven instruments and introduced him to music. Gordy followed in his mother’s footsteps and plays several instruments as well.
Gordy lived with his mother until the age of 13 and then moved to [[Los Angeles]] with his father Berry. He attended [[Beverly Hills High School]] with [[Benny Medina]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.themarshallproject.org/2016/05/30/the-real-fresh-prince-of-bel-air-had-a-father-in-prison|title=The Real Fresh Prince of Bel-Air Had a Father in Prison|date=2016-05-31|website=The Marshall Project|access-date=2017-03-09}}</ref> Years later Medina created the TV show [[Fresh Prince of Bel-Air]]; a semi-autobiographical TV sit com loosely based on Gordy inviting Medina to move into the Gordy Estate in [[Bel Air, Los Angeles|Bel Air]] when they were teenagers. Later the two wrote and produced records together for [[Motown]] and founded a teen idol band called [[Apollo (quintet)|Apollo]] for the Motown Records label. [[Teena Marie]] was originally in the group as the female lead, but dropped out before the band released their first single for Motown entitled ''Astro Disco''.
==Professional career==
Gordy's career began in 1973 working in the [[Motown Records]] mailroom. The early years of his career were spent in various administrative and creative capacities. Then in 1979, he released an album on Motown as a member of the group, [[Apollo (quintet)|Apollo]]. By the 1980s, he was known professionally as '''Kerry Ashby''' to separate himself at [[Motown Records|Motown]] from his father. He also worked as a writer and producer for various up and coming artists.
Later Gordy was promoted to the position of Director of [[A&R]], where he worked on projects with artists such as [[The Temptations]], [[The Four Tops]], [[Rick James]] and [[Billy Preston]] among others. He also worked on compilation albums for [[Diana Ross]] and [[Michael Jackson]]. He became a Senior Executive for the Gordy Company (his father’s company after selling Motown) in 1988 where he was responsible for supervising Business Affairs, A&R, Product Development, Administration and Personnel. Between 1991 and 1993 Gordy also consulted for [[Al Bell]]’s independently distributed label, [[Bellmark Records]].
In 1993, Gordy became the Vice President of two divisions for [[Paisley Park Records]], A&R and Artist Development, (a joint venture between [[Time-Warner]] and the superstar "[[Prince (musician)|Prince]]"). He produced and co-wrote [[George Clinton (funk musician)|George Clinton]]’s comeback hit "Paint the White House Black" utilizing icons of the rap and rock community such as Platinum artists [[Ice Cube]], [[Dr. Dre]] and the [[Red Hot Chili Peppers]]. The following year, he orchestrated a joint venture between [[Prince (musician)|Prince]]’s N.P.G. label and [[Bellmark Records]]. This union again yielded a world wide # 1 smash single, "The Most Beautiful Girl In The World."
Gordy served as Vice President of A&R for [[Warner Bros. Records]] Black Music Division, where in 1995 the [[R.I.A.A.]] (Recording Industry Association of America) awarded him with Gold records on [[Zapp and Roger]]'s "All the Greatest Hits" and [[Prince (musician)|Prince]]'s "Come" Album. His production of "I’m Looking Out For You," was the theme song for "Real Stories of the Highway Patrol." It was broadcast six nights a week in over 190 markets, including [[CBS]] in [[Los Angeles]] and also aired on the REAL TV Network.
He managed [[Rick James]] from 1996 until Rick died in 2004. Prior to that, in 1994, Gordy Kerry negotiated and obtained a three-act production deal with [[Interscope Records]] joint venture partner B-Rite Records. The first release from that venture (Gospel Gangstaz) enjoyed success.
===Other ventures=== In 1998 Gordy partnered with Gordon Bizar under the name Gordy-Bizar to securitize artists' and publishers' royalties. Financing deals were signed with [[Alice Walton|Alice Walton's]] investment banking firm [[Llama Company]] as well as [[Lehman Brothers]].
In 2003 Gordy signed a deal with [[Clear Channel Entertainment]] to produce his company’s first theatrical. He also signed a worldwide deal with the [[William Morris Agency]] to be represented in that arena.
In 2004 Gordy co-founded Siebers Style with exercise guru Debbie Siebers who earlier that year struck a deal with [[Beachbody]] to sell the ''Debbie Siebers Slim in 6'' rapid weight loss program. Debbie also became the fitness expert on the prime time reality show ''[[The Swan (TV series)|The Swan]]'' on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]. Gordy negotiated two book deals for Debbie with Silverback Publishing entitled "Energy Boost" and "Nutritional Makeover". Gordy also started a fifty item clothing line for Debbie in conjunction with the Romar Group.
Gordy consults the "Writers Collective" and has also consulted for [[Stevie Wonder]].
In 2007, Gordy founded Kerry Gordy Enterprises, LLC, an intellectual property and branding company focused in entertainment. He has signed Debbie Siebers, Clark Anderson, and [[Reggie Benjamin]] to his company. He also closed a publishing deal for his long-time client, partner, and friend, [[Bruce Fisher]], songwriter of several number one hits including the ''[[You Are So Beautiful]]'' with Evergreen Publishing.
In 2008, Gordy teamed up with [[John Davis (producer)|John Davis]], to produce two urban genre movies.
In 2012, Gordy contributed to writing and executive producing on the entire season's episodes of the television series ''The Jadagrace Show''.
==Family== The fourth eldest child of [[Berry Gordy]], Kerry's paternal half-siblings are: * Hazel Joy Gordy * Berry Gordy IV * Terry James Gordy * Sherry Gordy * [[Rockwell (musician)|Kennedy William Gordy]] * [[Rhonda Ross Kendrick|Rhonda Suzanne Gordy]] * [[Redfoo|Stefan Kendal Gordy]] (Redfoo of [[LMFAO]])
Kerry has three maternal half-siblings from his mother [[Ray Singleton|Raynoma Mayberry]]: * Cliff Liles, son of Charles Liles and Raynoma Mayberry * William Edward Singleton, Jr., son of Edward Singleton and Raynoma * Rya Singleton, daughter of Eddie and Raynoma
Kerry has one daughter named Juliet Gordy.

== Original design manufacturers (ODMs) == The vast majority of laptops on the market (94% in 2011) are manufactured by a small handful of Taiwan-based [[original design manufacturer]]s (ODM), although their production bases are located mostly in [[mainland China]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/global-and-china-laptop-and-tablet-pc-industry-report-2011-2012-152524185.html |title=Global and China Laptop and Tablet PC Industry Report, 2011-2012 |accessdate=2012-09-10}}</ref>
Major relationships include:<ref name=nir10/> * [[Quanta Computer|Quanta]] sells to (among others) HP, Lenovo, Apple, Acer, Toshiba, Dell, Sony, Fujitsu and NEC * [[Compal Electronics|Compal]] sells to (among others) Acer, Dell, Toshiba, Lenovo and HP/Compaq * [[Wistron]] (former manufacturing & design division of Acer) sells to Dell, Acer, Lenovo and HP * [[Inventec]] sells to Toshiba, HP, Dell and Lenovo * [[Pegatron]] sells to Asus, Toshiba, Apple, Dell and Acer * [[Foxconn]] sells to Asus, Dell, HP and Apple * [[Flextronics]] (former Arima Computer Corporation notebook division) sells to HP

There is a discrepancy between the 2009 numbers due to the various sources cited; i.e. the units sold by all ODMs add up to 144.3 million laptops, which is much more than the given total of 125 million laptops. The market share percentages currently refer to those 144.3 million total. Sources may indicate hard drive deliveries to the ODM instead of actual laptop sales, though the two numbers may be closely correlated.

69,084 (1999–2004){{cite news |title=Vikings Notes|url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=MN&p_theme=mn&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=0EFCD0A98D2BB332&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePMM|newspaper=[[Star Tribune]]|date=October 24, 2000|accessdate=September 26, 2011}}
68,400 (1998){{cite news |title=Quarterback Injuries Rule the Day|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1998/sep/07/sports/sp-20424|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=September 7, 1998|accessdate=September 26, 2011}} }} '''M&T Bank Stadium''' is a multi-purpose [[American football|football]] [[stadium]] located in [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]]. It is the home of the [[Baltimore Ravens]] of the [[National Football League]]. The stadium is immediately adjacent to [[Oriole Park at Camden Yards]], the home of the [[Baltimore Orioles]]. Often referred to as "Ravens Stadium",[http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2012-10-11/sports/bal-mt-bank-stadium-is-named-one-of-the-toughest-venues-for-opposing-teams-to-play-in-in-the-nfl-20121011_1_m-t-bank-stadium-nfl-teams-theravens Ravens to M&T Bank Stadium: 'Who loves ya, baby?'], Baltimore Sun M&T Bank Stadium officially opened in 1998, and is currently one of the most praised stadiums in the NFL for fan amenities, ease of access, concessions and other facilities.{{cite web|url=http://www.thesportsroadtrip.com/baltimoreravens.html |title=Services |publisher=Thesportsroadtrip.com |date= |accessdate=2014-05-19}} The stadium was originally known as '''Ravens Stadium at Camden Yards''', until [[PSINet]] acquired the [[naming rights]] in 1999, naming it '''PSINet Stadium'''. It then reverted to '''Ravens Stadium''' in 2002 when PSINet filed for bankruptcy. The naming rights deal for M&T Bank Stadium was renewed for $60M over 10 years in 2014, extending the name through 2027. ==History== Ground was broken for the new stadium in mid-1996, shortly after the arrival of the Ravens. The team played its first two years at [[Memorial Stadium (Baltimore)|Memorial Stadium]]. Although there was some sentiment from Baltimore residents in having the Ravens stay there permanently, it was deemed too old to host an NFL team. (The Orioles moved away from Memorial Stadium after the [[1991 Major League Baseball season|1991 season]].) The stadium site was previously the site of the [[Wm. Knabe & Co.]] piano factory, which closed during [[The Great Depression]]. A sidewalk keyboard mosaic on the southwest corner of the stadium honors the company's legacy. In [[2003 NFL season|2003]], [[M&T Bank]] acquired naming rights to the stadium. The bank had recently entered the Baltimore market with its purchase of Allfirst Bank. Two other companies were in the running to be granted naming rights to the stadium; they were reportedly [[Nextel]] and [[CarMax]]. Following the September 2002 death of [[History of the Baltimore Colts|Baltimore Colts]] [[quarterback]] [[Johnny Unitas]], public sentiment leaned toward renaming the then-sponsorless stadium after the Baltimore icon. However, the Ravens and the [[Maryland Stadium Authority]] held firm in their right to negotiate naming rights fees. In the end, the plaza in front of the main entrance to the Ravens' stadium was named "Unitas Plaza", complete with a bronze statue of the [[Pro Football Hall of Fame|Hall of Famer]]. The plaza formerly featured large banners, each containing a picture of Unitas in his playing days, flanking the stadium entrance. After 10 years, these were replaced by large metal 19s (Unitas's number) for the [[2012 NFL season|2012 season]]. In 2014, the Ravens unveiled a new statue of long-time Raven [[Ray Lewis]] next to Unitas' statue. The bronze figure depicts Lewis in the final pose of his iconic "squirrel dance", which he would perform before every Ravens home game upon coming on to the field. ==Design== The stadium contains five levels, being the lower bowl, club level, 300 suites level, 400 suites level, and the upper bowl. The lower bowl contains 42 rows of seats, split into two sections. The seats below the tunnel entrances are labeled from 1 to 18, while the seats above the tunnels are labeled from 19 to 42, except in sections 123-130, which contain rows 19-35, due to the press box taking up sideline space. On the club level, the rows are labeled from 1 to 13 on the sidelines, and 1 to 17 in the corners where no suites are located. In the upper bowl, the sideline seats are labeled from 1 to 32, while in the upper bowl end zones, the rows range from 1 to 26. Seat widths for the lower and upper bowls of the stadium vary from 19 to 21 inches, due to the curve design of the stadium, while the padded club seats range from 21 to 23 inches respectively. The venue is served by the [[Hamburg Street (Baltimore Light Rail station)|Hamburg Street station]] of the [[Baltimore Light Rail]]. [[File:M&T Bank Stadium, 2013 Postseason purple LED lighting.jpg|300px|thumbnail|North-end view during the Ravens' Super Bowl XLVII run in 2013. The stadium is lighted in purple LED every Ravens postseason.]] ===Playing surface=== The stadium originally featured a natural grass surface. However, an artificial surface, Sportexe Momentum Turf, was installed for the [[2003 NFL Season|2003]] season, which in turn was replaced by a new-generation Sportexe Momentum 51 in [[2010 NFL season|2010]]. On December 4, 2015, the Ravens announced that in 2016 the team will go back to natural grass playing surface.{{cite news |last=Hensley|first=Jamison|title=Ravens Replace Artificial Turf at M&T Bank Stadium|url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2010-05-06/sports/bs-sp-ravens-turf-stadium-0506-20100504_1_turf-fields-lardarius-webb-ravens|accessdate=January 15, 2012|newspaper=[[The Baltimore Sun]]|date=May 6, 2010}} The listed capacity for M&T Bank Stadium is 71,008. ==Tenants== The Ravens are the stadium's primary tenants. On December 7, 2008, an M&T Bank Stadium then-record crowd of 71,438 watched the Baltimore Ravens defeat the [[2008 Washington Redskins season|Washington Redskins]] 24-10 on ''[[NBC Sunday Night Football|Sunday Night Football]]'', only to be surpassed the next week when the [[2008 Pittsburgh Steelers season|Pittsburgh Steelers]] defeated the Ravens 13–9 in front of 71,502.{{cite web|url=http://scores.espn.go.com/nfl/recap?gameId=281207033|title=Redskins vs. Ravens - Game Recap - December 7, 2008 - ESPN|author=|date=|website=ESPN.com|accessdate=22 March 2018}} On January 15, 2012, a record crowd of 71,547, the largest in Ravens history,{{cite news |title=A Typical Ravens Success: With Grit and Without Fear|first=Ben|last=Shpigel|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/16/sports/football/still-unbeatable-at-home-ravens-outlast-texans.html|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=January 15, 2012|accessdate=January 15, 2012}} was in attendance at the 2011 Divisional Playoff Game in Baltimore against the [[2011 Houston Texans season|Houston Texans]], which the Ravens won 20–13. ==Notable events== ===College football=== In [[2000 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2000]], the stadium hosted the [[Army–Navy Game]] for the first time and has subsequently hosted the rivalry game in [[2007 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2007]], [[2014 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2014]], and [[2016 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2016]]. In 2005, the stadium was the site of the first rematch in the [[2005 Maryland Terrapins football team|Maryland]]–[[Navy Midshipmen football|Navy]] series known as the "[[Crab Bowl Classic]]" in 40 years.{{cite news|title=Navy Feels Snubbed By Terps; What Else Is New? |first=Mike |last=Burke |url=http://www.times-news.com/localsports/local_story_220111942.html?keyword=topstory |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120529191951/http://www.times-news.com/localsports/local_story_220111942.html?keyword=topstory |dead-url=yes |archive-date=May 29, 2012 |newspaper=[[Cumberland Times-News]] |date=August 8, 2007 |accessdate=January 17, 2008 }} The two teams played again at M&T Bank Stadium on September 6, 2010 and [[2010 Maryland Terrapins football team|Maryland]] won 17–14. On October 28, 2006, the stadium held a contest between [[2006 Notre Dame Fighting Irish football team|Notre Dame]] and [[2006 Navy Midshipmen football team|Navy]] in which Notre Dame won 38–14. In 2014, the stadium played host to [[2014 Ohio State Buckeyes football team|Ohio State]]–[[2014 Navy Midshipmen football team|Navy]], Ohio State won 34–17.{{cite news |title=Ravens' M&T Bank Stadium to Host Ohio State-Navy Matchup in 2014|first=Tim|last=Gardner|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/campusrivalry/post/2010/02/ravens-mt-bank-stadium-to-host-ohio-state-navy-matchup-in-2014/1#.T8O-vNWvKSo|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|date=February 27, 2010|accessdate=May 27, 2012}} In 2013, the annual [[Maryland – West Virginia football rivalry|rivalry]] between [[2013 Maryland Terrapins football team|Maryland]] and [[2013 West Virginia Mountaineers football team|West Virginia]] was held at the stadium.{{cite web|url=http://www.wvmetronews.com/wvu.cfm?func=displayfullstory&storyid=46231|title=WV MetroNews – WVU Sports|author=|date=|website=www.wvmetronews.com|accessdate=22 March 2018}} On October 24, 2015, the stadium hosted a Big Ten match-up between [[Maryland Terrapins football|Maryland]] and [[Penn State Nittany Lions football|Penn State]] in which Maryland lost 31–30.{{cite news| url=http://www.bizjournals.com/baltimore/news/2013/06/03/maryland-penn-state-mt-bank-stadium.html?page=all | title=Maryland, Penn State to play at M&T Bank Stadium in 2015}} ===High school football=== The [[Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association]] (MPSSAA) holds the four state football championships for Maryland's public high schools at M&T Bank Stadium. Two Baltimore [[High school football in North America|high school football]] rivalry games have been held at the stadium in November. [[Baltimore City College Football|Baltimore City College]] plays [[Baltimore Polytechnic Institute]] [[City–Poly football rivalry|every November]], in one of the oldest [[List of high school football rivalries (100 years+)|high school football rivalries in the United States]]. Every Thanksgiving, [[Loyola Blakefield]] and [[Calvert Hall College High School|Calvert Hall College]] also square off in what has now been called for many years as the [[American football on Thanksgiving#High school football|Turkey Bowl]], usually reaching up to 13,000 people in the audience.{{cite web|author= |url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2011-07-14/sports/bs-va-sp-turkey-bowl-0715-20110714_1_calvert-hall-and-loyola-brother-thomas-zoppo-loyola-grad |title=Turkey Bowl will move to Towson's Johnny Unitas Stadium for one year – Baltimore Sun |publisher=Articles.baltimoresun.com |date=2011-07-14 |accessdate=2014-05-19}} Both games were once played back-to-back on Thanksgiving Day at [[Memorial Stadium (Baltimore)|Memorial Stadium]]. However, when City College and Polytechnic joined the MPSSAA before 1994 season, the game was forced to be played in early November, due to MPSSAA rules and playoff schedule. ===Soccer=== [[File:2016-05-11 08 00 03 View of M&T Bank Stadium from southbound Maryland State Route 295 (Russell Street) in downtown Baltimore City, Maryland.jpg|thumb|right|View of the stadium from Russell Street]] On July 24, 2009, English [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.]] won 2–1 against Italian [[Serie A]] team [[A.C. Milan]] in the first [[World Football Challenge]] at M&T Bank Stadium in front of a crowd of 71,203.{{cite news |title=Soccer Invasion|first=Kevin|last=Van Valkenburg|url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2009-07-25/sports/0907250016_1_ronaldinho-ac-milan-chelsea|newspaper=[[The Baltimore Sun]]|date=July 25, 2009|accessdate=July 25, 2009}} On July 28, 2012 the stadium hosted a match between [[Premier League]] teams [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] before 42,723 fans.{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2012/jul/28/hype-exceeds-play-liverpool-tottenham-scoreless-dr/ |title=Hype exceeds the play in Liverpool-Tottenham scoreless draw |work=Washington Times |date=2012-07-28 |accessdate=2014-05-19}} The stadium was a venue for the [[2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup]], drawing a crowd of 70,450 to watch a quarter finals doubleheader between the United States v. El Salvador, and Honduras v. Costa Rica.[http://www.concacaf.com/page/GoldCup/NewsDetail/0,,12813~3050948,00.html ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130126061124/http://www.concacaf.com/page/GoldCup/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C12813~3050948%2C00.html |date=January 26, 2013 }} The [[2015 CONCACAF Gold Cup]] had two quarterfinals games at the stadium: United States v. Cuba and Haiti v. Jamaica, played in front of 37,994 spectators. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left; width:95%;" style="text-align:center" |- !style="text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};"|Date !style="text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};"|Winning Team !style="text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};"|Result !style="text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};"|Losing Team !style="text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};"|Tournament !style="text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};"|Spectators |- |style="text-align:center;"|July 24, 2009||'''{{flagicon|ENG}} [[Chelsea F.C.]]'''||style="text-align:center;"|2–1||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[A.C. Milan]]||style="text-align:center;"|[[World Football Challenge]]||style="text-align:center;"|71,203 |- |style="text-align:center;"|July 28, 2012||{{flagicon|ENG}} [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]||style="text-align:center;"|0–0||{{flagicon|ENG}} [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]||style="text-align:center;"|Club Friendly||style="text-align:center;"|42,723 |- |style="text-align:center;" rowspan=2|July 21, 2013||'''{{fb|USA}}'''||style="text-align:center;"|5–1||{{fb|SLV}}||style="text-align:center;" rowspan=2|[[2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup]] Quarterfinals||style="text-align:center;" rowspan=2|70,540 |- |'''{{fb|HON}}'''||style="text-align:center;"|1–0||{{fb|CRC}} |- |style="text-align:center;" rowspan=2|July 18, 2015||'''{{fb|USA}}'''||style="text-align:center;"|6–0||{{fb|CUB}}||style="text-align:center;" rowspan=2|[[2015 CONCACAF Gold Cup]] Quarterfinals||style="text-align:center;" rowspan=2|37,994 |- |'''{{fb|JAM}}'''||style="text-align:center;"|1–0||{{fb|HAI}} |} ===Lacrosse=== The stadium serves as an alternate venue for the [[Johns Hopkins University]] [[Johns Hopkins Blue Jays men's lacrosse|men's lacrosse team]], and was the site of the semifinals and final of the [[NCAA Division I Men's Lacrosse Championship]] in [[2003 NCAA Division I Men's Lacrosse Championship|2003]], [[2004 NCAA Division I Men's Lacrosse Championship|2004]], [[2007 NCAA Division I Men's Lacrosse Championship|2007]], [[2010 NCAA Division I Men's Lacrosse Championship|2010]], [[2011 NCAA Division I Men's Lacrosse Championship|2011]], and [[2014 NCAA Division I Men's Lacrosse Championship|2014]]. [[Major League Lacrosse]]'s [[Baltimore Bayhawks]] used the stadium as their home during the 2002 season. ===Music and entertainment=== {| class="wikitable" style=font-size:100% style="text-align:center" |- ! width=12% style="text-align:center;{{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};|Date ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};|Artist ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};|Opening act(s) ! width=16% style="text-align:center;{{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};|Tour / Concert name ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};|Attendance ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};|Revenue ! width=20% style="text-align:center;{{NFLPrimaryStyle|Baltimore Ravens|border=2}};|Notes |- | July 4, 2000 || Metallica || [[Korn]]

[[Volbeat]] || [[WorldWired Tour]] || 40,850 / 43,230 || $5,001,943 || |} Popular music festival [[HFStival]] appeared at the stadium in 1999 & 2005, as [[Foo Fighters]], [[Red Hot Chili Peppers]], [[Silverchair]], [[The Mighty Mighty Bosstones]], [[The Offspring]], [[Blink-182]], [[Goo Goo Dolls]], [[Billy Idol]], and [[Coldplay]] have all played the concert. [[Monster Jam]] was held at the stadium for the first time in 2011, and the stadium has been announced to become a normal stop on the summer tour. Monster Jam returned for the third time on June 8, 2013. ===Popular culture=== It served as Nextel Stadium, the home field for the fictional Washington Sentinels in the 2000 film ''[[The Replacements (film)|The Replacements]]''.[https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/2000/08/11/the-replacements-yet-another-replay/77ac5eaf-d037-402d-9be5-ef8cbb750b96/ O'Sullivan, Michael. "'The Replacements': Yet Another Replay," ''The Washington Post'', Friday, August 11, 2000.] The stadium was also supposed to be the location{{Citation needed|date=December 2008}} of the football game in the 2002 film ''[[The Sum of All Fears (film)|The Sum of All Fears]]'' and included footage of the presidential motorcade going to the building. However, the stadium used for the aerial shots is the domed [[Olympic Stadium (Montreal)|Olympic Stadium]] in Montreal,{{Citation needed|date=December 2008}} while the book used Denver as the locale for the attack. It was featured in "Stadium," a 2013 [[television]] [[public service announcement]] which was part of the "I Want To Be Recycled" [[advertising campaign]] for [[Keep America Beautiful]] and the [[Ad Council]]. The stadium is partially constructed from post-consumer recycled [[aluminum]].{{cite web|url=http://www.adcouncil.org/News-Events/Press-Releases/I-Want-To-Be-Recycled-Campaign-to-Target-the-Nearly-Two-Thirds-62-Percent-of-Americans-Who-Are-Not-Avid-Recyclers-According-to-New-Research-Released-Today|title="I Want To Be Recycled" Campaign to Target the Nearly Two-Thirds (62 Percent) of Americans Who Are Not Avid Recyclers, According to New Research Released Today|author=|date=|website=adcouncil.org|accessdate=22 March 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-KF4kSGuVM|title="I Want To Be Recycled" - Stadium :15|first=|last=Keep America Beautiful|date=10 July 2013|publisher=|accessdate=22 March 2018|via=YouTube}} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== {{Commons category|M&T Bank Stadium}} *[http://www.baltimoreravens.com/Gameday/MT_Bank_Stadium.aspx Stadium site on baltimoreravens.com] *[https://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=baltimore,+md&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=33.352165,60.46875&ie=UTF8&ll=39.283676,-76.621635&spn=0,359.985237&z=16&layer=c&cbll=39.279349,-76.622289&panoid=a9KTfvtx3eObLs982NbOeA&cbp=12,193.29085702465497,,0,-15.53779069767442 M&T Bank Stadium on Google Street View] *[http://seatingchartview.com/mt-bank-stadium/ M&T Bank Stadium Seating Chart] {{s-start-collapsible|header={{s-sta|et}}}} {{succession box | title = Home of the

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox person |name = Marc Bolland |birth_date = {{Birth-date and age|df=yes|28 March 1959}} |birth_place = [[Apeldoorn]], [[Amsterdam]], Netherlands |education = University of Groningen |residence = [[London]], England |nationality = Dutch |title = [[Chief operating officer|COO]] of [[Heineken International|Heineken]] (2005-06)
[[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of [[Morrisons]] (2006–09)
CEO of [[Marks and Spencer|M&S]] (2010–16) |occupation = [[Businessperson|Businessman]] |years_active = 1987–present |website = |salary = {{gain}} £975,000{{cite web| url=http://corporate.marksandspencer.com/investors/press_releases/RNS/MarcBolland| publisher=Marks and Spencer| title=M&S announces Marc Bolland’s start date & remuneration| accessdate=1 February 2010| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101027091713/http://corporate.marksandspencer.com/investors/press_releases/RNS/MarcBolland| archivedate=27 October 2010| df=dmy-all}} |successor = [[Steve Rowe (businessman)|Steve Rowe]] }} '''Marc Bolland''' (born 28 March 1959) is a Dutch businessman, who was the CEO of [[Marks & Spencer]], after having been CEO of UK supermarket company [[Morrisons]]. ==Biography== ===Early life=== He received a bachelor's degree from the [[Hotelschool The Hague]], and then an [[Master of Business Administration|MBA]] at the [[University of Groningen]].{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/5741752/WM-Morrison-chief-executive-Marc-Bolland-on-how-he-has-transformed-the-supermarket-chain.html |newspaper=Telegraph |title=WM Morrison chief executive Marc Bolland on how he has transformed the supermarket chain |date=July 2009| accessdate=17 August 2015}} ===Heineken=== He began as a graduate at [[Amsterdam]]-based [[Heineken International]] [[Naamloze vennootschap|NV]], the third largest brewer in the world, in 1987. Bolland worked in various international management positions in Africa and Central Europe before joining the Heineken board in 2001. He became [[chief operating officer]] in 2005. Bolland has been credited with both building and rolling out the Heineken brand internationally.{{cite news| url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/news/788030.bolland_to_refresh_parts_of_morrisons/| newspaper=Bradford Telegraph and Argus |title=Bolland to refresh parts of Morrisons| first=Richard |last=Woodward |date=8 June 2006 |accessdate= 17 August 2015}}{{cite web| url=http://2012-ny.bsr.org/en/speakers/view/marc-bolland| publisher=Business for Social Responsibility| title=Speaker: Marc Bolland| accessdate=17 August 2015}} ===Morrisons=== In September 2006, he was appointed CEO of the UK supermarket chain [[Morrisons]]. Morrisons had acquired [[Safeway (UK)|Safeway]] in 2004 creating a 130,000 people strong retail conglomerate in the UK. The merger initially proved unsuccessful. Bolland joined after five profit warnings with a brief to turn round the company.{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2009/nov/18/marc-bolland-profile-marks-and-spencer| newspaper=The Guardian| title=High-flying Dutchman makes it to the top | first=David | last=Teather| date=18 November 2009 |accessdate=17 August 2015}} By 2008 Morrisons had achieved strong growth in both market share and profits, and in 2008, Bolland was announced as The Times "Businessman of the year".{{cite web| url=http://www.worldofceos.com/dossiers/marc-bolland| publisher=World of CEOs| title=Dossiers - Marc Bolland| accessdate=17 August 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/has-marks-spencer-boss-marc-bolland-failed-his-turnaround-plan-1449303| newspaper=International Business Times| title=Has Marks & Spencer Boss Marc Bolland Failed in his Turnaround Plan?| first=Sean |last=Martin| date=20 May 2014| accessdate=17 August 2015}} Under his guidance, Morrisons "...gained significant market share from rivals".{{cite news| url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/ms-poaches-morrison-chief-to-be-ceo-2009-11-18| newspaper=Market Watch| title=M&S appoints Morrison boss Marc Bolland CEO |date=18 Nov 2009| first=Aude |last=Lagorce| accessdate=17 August 2015}} ===Marks & Spencer=== In November 2009, it was announced that Bolland would become CEO of [[Marks & Spencer]] Group PLC. In May 2010, he took over from the then chairman & CEO [[Sir Stuart Rose]]. Bolland launched a plan to grow M&S into an international multi-channel retailer. The [[London Evening Standard|Evening Standard]] named Bolland as one of "London's 1000 most influential people" for 2010.{{cite news|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard-home/article-23897620-londons-1000-most-influential-people-2010-tycoons-and-retailers.do |newspaper=Evening Standard |title=London's 1000 most influential people 2010: Tycoons & Retailers |date=15 November 2010 |accessdate=17 August 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110303202728/http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard-home/article-23897620-londons-1000-most-influential-people-2010-tycoons-and-retailers.do |archivedate=3 March 2011 |df= }} During September 2011, he announced a new look store environment for M&S's UK stores, with a plan to complete the roll out to the entire UK estate by mid-2013. In 2011, M&S returned to France after a 10-year absence and also started the development of a new digital platform that was launched in February 2014.{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2011/apr/01/marks-spencer-paris-champs-elysees| newspaper=The Guardian| title=Marks & Spencer makes Paris comeback with Champs Elysées store|first=Kim Willsher| last=Dan Milmo and Marie Winckler| date=1 April 2011| accessdate=17 August 2015}} In 2011, Bolland received an honorary doctorate from [[York St John University]].{{cite web|title=Honorary Graduates 2011 {{!}} York St John|url=http://www.yorksj.ac.uk/about/honorary-graduates/honorary-graduates-2011.aspx|accessdate=12 July 2013}} He was named as "Most Admired Leader" at Management Today magazine's "Britain's Most Admired Companies 2011" awards having been nominated by his peers in the FTSE 100.{{cite journal| url=http://www.managementtoday.co.uk/news/1107358| journal=Management Today| first=Rebecca |last=Burn-Callander| date=1 December 2011| title=Britain's Most Admired Companies 2011| accessdate=17 August 2015}} In 2014 Bolland was appointed as the Prince of Wales National Ambassador for Business in the Community and in Feb 2015 Bolland joined the board of Coca-Cola as a Director. In January 2016, it was announced that Bolland would be retiring as CEO of Marks and Spencer effective April 2016, and would be replaced by [[Steve Rowe (businessman)|Steve Rowe]].{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35249317| newspaper=The BBC| title=Marks and Spencer chief executive Marc Bolland to quit| date=7 January 2016| accessdate=7 January 2016}} In June 2016, it was announced that Bolland was appointed as a non-executive director of IAG (International Airlines Group).{{cite web|url=https://news.sky.com/story/bolland-flies-in-to-british-airways-owner-iag-10258300|title=Bolland Flies In To British Airways Owner IAG|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.londonstockexchange.com/exchange/news/market-news/market-news-detail/IAG/12857177.html|title=Directorate Change - RNS - London Stock Exchange|website=www.londonstockexchange.com}} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20101210071927/http://www.morrisons.co.uk/Corporate/About-Morrisons/Board-members/ Morrisons profile] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20091122184900/http://www.heinekeninternational.com/pages/article/S2/mjbolland.aspx Heineken] {{S-start}} {{S-bus}} {{S-bef|before= Sir [[Stuart Rose]] }} {{S-ttl|title= Chief Executive of Marks & Spencer|years= May 2010 - April 2016}} {{S-aft|after= [[Steve Rowe (businessman)|Steve Rowe]] }} {{S-bef|before= Sir [[Ken Morrison]] }} {{S-ttl|title= Chief Executive of Morrisons|years= September 2006 - December 2009}} {{S-aft|after= [[Ian Gibson (businessman)|Ian Gibson]] (temporary) }} {{S-end}} {{Manpower Inc.}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bolland, Marc}} [[Category:1959 births]] [[Category:People from Apeldoorn]] [[Category:University of Groningen alumni]] [[Category:Heineken]] [[Category:Dutch chief executives in the retail industry]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dutch businesspeople]] [[Category:Chief operating officers]] [[Category:Directors of The Coca-Cola Company]] [[Category:21st-century Belgian politicians]]
